oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Carte de visite of US Colored Cavalry Sgt. Dick Johnson
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Hand-colored carte de visite of African American Sgt. Dick Johnson, 3rd US Colored Cavalry (USCC), detailed to David Preston Sherfy. On February 18, 1865, at Hamburg, Ark., Sherfy fell from his horse and severely injured his leg. Sgt. Johnson cared for Sherfy during their four-day ride to Vicksburg, Miss.
